FUNCTION_TITLE

FUNCTION_DESCRIPTION

plot_rast(in_rast, band = 1, in_poly = NULL, in_points = NULL,
  background = FALSE, limits = NULL, tails = c(0.01, 0.99),
  palette = "RdYlGn", legend_type = "standard", col_outlow = "gray10",
  col_outhigh = "gray90", maxpixels = 1e+05, title = "Raster Plot",
  plot_now = TRUE, ...)

Arguments

in_rast

PARAM_DESCRIPTION
band

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: 1
in_poly

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: NULL
in_points

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: NULL
background

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: FALSE
limits

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: NULL
tails

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: c(0.01, 0.99)
palette

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: 'RdYlGn'
legend_type

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: 'standard'
col_outlow

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: 'gray10'
col_outhigh

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: 'gray90'
maxpixels

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: 1e+05
title

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: 'Raster Plot'
plot_now

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: TRUE
...

PARAM_DESCRIPTION

Value

OUTPUT_DESCRIPTION

Details

DETAILS

See also

layer stack,quantile levelplot brewer.pal

Examples

if(interactive()){
 library(sprawl)

 in_rast <- system.file("extdata", "gNDVI.tif", package = "sprawl.data")
 in_vect <- create_fishnet(in_rast, pix_for_cell = 150)

 # plot only the raster
 plot_rast(in_rast)

 # add a polygon and change the legend
 plot_rast(in_rast, in_poly = in_vect,
           tails = c(0.1, 0.99),
           legend = "custom",
           palette = "RdYlBu" ,
           maxpixels = 10e5)
 }
